Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CT3 (Capitellacin analog, Arg-rich, synthetic AMPs, 2S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (95%) toCapitellacinR: 26%; C: 21%;Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: 0.2 mM IPTG-induced, expressed as a 8x His-tag fusion protein in E. coli BL21 (DE3), affinity chromatographic purification, yield: 5.1 mg/L.Activity: active against Gram+ M. luteus B-1314 (MIC 4 uM), S. aureus 209P (MIC 8 uM), B. subtilis B-886 (MIC 32 uM), E. coli ML-35p or ATTC 25922 or CI 3600  or CI 214 (MIC 0.5-1 uM),  E. cloacae CI 4172 (MIC 8 uM), A. baumanii CI 2675 (MIC 0.25 uM), P. aeruginosa PAO1 (MIC 2 uM), and K. pneumonia ATCC 700603 (MIC 4 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Safronova VN, Panteleev PV, Sukhanov SV, Toropygin IY, Bolosov IA, Ovchinnikova TV. 2022
Literature Information.Title: Mechanism of Action and Therapeutic Potential of the beta-Hairpin Antimicrobial Peptide Capitellacin from the Marine Polychaeta Capitella teleta.
